00005 import wx

00009 
00010 import matplotlib.numerix as nx
00011 matplotlib.use("WX")
00012 from PlotItemRegistry import PlotItemRegistry

00014      
00015 class MatplotlibWrap(wx.Panel):#Plotter):
00016     """Plotter for matplotlib wrapped in a wx panel
00017 
00018     All plotter rendering will consist of the following steps:
00019 plot.clear()
00020 plot.properties()
00021 plot.points()/plot.curve()/...
00022 plot.render()
00023 """
00024     
00025     def __init__(self,parent, id):
00026         """
00027         Define the plotting panel for the graph.
00028         """
00029         wx.Panel.__init__(self, parent=parent, id=id)
00030         self.parent=parent
00031         self.plotItems=parent.plotItems
00032 
00033         # Add the plot widget
00034         self._add_plot_widget()
00035         
00036     def addLine(self,x,y):
00037         # TODO: eventually will specify which figure and axes we want to add to
00038         line, = self.axes.plot(x,y)
00039         
00040         PlotItemRegistry.lines = PlotItemRegistry.lines+1
00041         #self.plotItems.append(['line',line])   
00042         self.plotItems['line'+str(PlotItemRegistry.lines)] = line  
00043         # this method should be called anytime a new object is loaded into the plot
00044         self.parent.plotBrowser.updateList()  
00045 
00046     def _add_plot_widget(self):
00047         """
00048         Add the plotting widget to the panel
00049         """
00050         # for now make it interactive, although in a real gui one will want to toggle this with a button
00051         matplotlib.interactive(True)
00052         # Put a figure on the panel, add some axes and put it on a canvas
00053         self.figure = Figure()
00054         self.axes   = self.figure.add_subplot(111)
00055         self.canvas = FigureCanvas(self,-1,self.figure)
00056         #self.lines = None
00057         #self.plotItems.append(['figure',self.figure])
00058         #self.plotItems.append(['axes',self.axes])
00059         #self.plotItems['canvas']=self.canvas
00060         self.plotItems['figure']=self.figure
00061         self.plotItems['axes']=self.axes
00062 
00063         # On Windows, default frame size behaviour is incorrect
00064         # you don't need this under Linux
00065         if False:
00066             tw, th = self.toolbar.GetSizeTuple()
00067             fw, fh = self.canvas.GetSizeTuple()
00068             self.toolbar.SetSize(wx.Size(fw, th))
00069 
00070         # Layout the window
00071         sizer = wx.BoxSizer(wx.VERTICAL)
00072         sizer.Add(self.canvas, 1, wx.LEFT|wx.TOP|wx.GROW)
00073         self.SetSizer(sizer)  
00074
